content: in front of the fpdc you just made yo & pull up a loop 3 loops on hook yo & pull through 1st 2 loops yo & pull through remaining 2 loops fpdc cross st is now complete pattern notes - please read the entire pattern before you start working this square up… it s always a good rule of thumb to prepare yourself for possible confusion before you start the work - as stated in the materials section instructions for both colorways will be included in each round for colorway 1 the original design sapphire will be referred to as color a in the pattern orange will be referred to as color b in the pattern for colorway 2 the tri-color design sapphire will be referred to as color a in the pattern orange will be referred to as color b in the pattern varsity gold will be referred to as color c in the pattern - the square measures roughly 9 5-10 inches if you use the same materials as i do - anything that falls after one asterisk and before a double asterisk abbreviated as * to ** indicates the entire written section between those markers as one repeat after the double asterisk there will be written instructions on how many times the repeat must be performed before continuing the rest of the written round - when you see stitches fall between brackets as shown below the written stitches within those brackets should be worked into the one stitch indicated in the pattern after the brackets end pattern round 1 starting with color a and using the mc method chain 1 work 8 single_crochet into the mc pull tail tight to close the hole slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet 8 single_crochet round 2 chain 1 work 2 single_crochet into the next st & each remaining single_crochet around the last st worked in the round should be over the slip_stitch from the end of the previous round this is how it should be in every round unless otherwise stated for both colorways drop color a & pick up color b slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet 16 single_crochet round 3 chain 1 work 1 single_crochet into next st 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet *1 single_crochet in next single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet ** repeat from * to ** to end of round for tri-color colorway only drop color b & pick up color c slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet 24 single_crochet round 4 chain 1 work 1 fpdc around the 1st single_crochet from round 1 directly below skip single_crochet from previous round the single_crochet behind the fpdc just made 1 single_crochet in next single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet *work 1 fpdc around the next single_crochet from round 1 directly below skip next single_crochet from previous round 1 single_crochet in next single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet ** repeat from * to ** to end of round for both colorways drop current color & pick up color a slip_stitch to 1st
